intro: Clonodia mollis, commonly known as the soft clonodia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Clonodia mollis produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
